Rogerio Teixeira da Silva

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/7913656062985003
  • Última atualização do currículo em 16/01/2018

Degree in Medicine from the Federal University of São Paulo (1991), Masters in Orthopaedics and Traumatology, Federal University of São Paulo (2000) and Doctorate in Sciences (PhD) at Orthopaedics and Traumatology Departament - Federal University of São Paulo (2006). Founder and President of NEO - Center for Research in Sports and Orthopedics; works as advisory board member of the Brazilian Society for Arthroscopy and Sports Traumatology (SBRATE), a non-profit medical society which he chaired in 2009 and 2010. He is a member of the Brazilian Society of Sports Medicine (SBME) and Brazilian Society of Orthopaedics and Traumatology (SBOT), since 1996, which served as Coordinator of Institutional Relations in 2011 and managed the Fiscal Advisor Board in 2012. Founded in 1999 the Medical Department of the Brazilian Tennis Confederation, having served as his supervisor until January 2010. In the international field act as coordinator of the South American Committee of the Society for Tennis Medicine and Science, and a member of ISAKOS (International Society for Arthroscopy Knee Surgery and Orthopedic Sports Medicine. Has a great experience in medicine with emphasis in Orthopaedics and Sports Traumatology, acting professionally in her private office in the city of São Paulo since 1999. Coordinated a team of orthopedics at Hospital Sao Luiz Morumbi Unit during the years 2010-2013. Special attention in his research is given to the study of injuries in athletes, particularly soccer, running and tennis players (amateur and professionals). Is was also a member of the open medical staff of Albert Einstein Hospital, Hospital Sao Luiz and Samaritan Hospital. At the educational field develops courses and continuing medical education projects and research in the areas of orthopedics and sports traumatology. Living now in North Reading, MA - United States (Texto informado pelo autor)

Iniciação científica
1.
Marcelo Soares da Silva. Tratamento das lesões do ligamento cruzado anterior em atletas de futebol: Experiência de 6 anos no Clube de Regatas do Flamengo. 2006. Iniciação Científica - Sociedade Brasileira de Ortopedia e Traumatologia. Orientador: Rogerio Teixeira da Silva.



Outras informações relevantes

 
Active researcher in the field of knee surgery, arthroscopy and orthopedic sports medicine. Was the founder of the Brazilian Tennis Confederation in 1999 and worked until 2008 as the Chief Medical Officer of the Davis Cup and Fed Cup Brazil teams. Created the NEO and coordinate the research there until 2014 before moving to the USA. 
In Brazil had an active participation in medical societies, and was one of the founders of SBRATE - a merge between the Arthroscopy Brazilian Society and the Orthopedic Sports Medicine Committee. During his tenure as the President for the society in 2009-2010 term was was the Chairman of the Fellowship International Program of the society, that helped in the specialization of 12 young orthopedic surgeons - in partnership with important international institutions like Stanford University - California, USA.
